newsitem.title: FRANCE: Havas plans 20 pct SFP stake - source.
newsitem.headline: Havas plans 20 pct SFP stake - source.

text.p: French media group Havas plans to take a 20 percent stake in the SFP film and television production company through its ITI-Tele Images unit and 34 percent in Belgian firm LBO Convoy as part of LBO's offer for SFP, a source close to the deal told Reuters on Friday.
The French government is privatising loss-making Societe Francaise de Production through a private placement.
LBO Convoy, headed by Fabrice Giger and Nicolas Berggruen, has offered 57 million francs for SFP and has asked the state for a mininum 992 million franc recapitalisaiton, the source said.
Dutch telecommunications group and post group KPN is an LBO shareholder.
LBO's offer for SFP would retain 700 out of the company's 1,010 employees. Giger was due to meet the privatisation committee of SFP's works committee on Friday, the source said.
The French Finance Ministry is expected to announce its choice of bidder on October 9, the day before the works committee next meets.
The ministry said on September 27 the privatisation timetable should allow the works committee to give its opinion of the rival offers.
French businessman Walter Butler has put in a rival 50 million franc bid for SFP.
